meta.content: Front Page; New York and Region
meta.name: online_sections

block.p: U.S. Quits Court Treaty Over Death Row Order Prompted by an international tribunal's decision last year ordering new hearings for 51 Mexicans on death rows in the United States, the State Department said the United States had withdrawn from the protocol that gave the tribunal jurisdiction over such cases.
PAGE A16
Ferrer Campaign's New Focus Fernando Ferrer casts his New York City mayoral campaign as the nation's major electoral fight between Democrats and Republicans this year.
PAGE B1
Glenn Davis Is Dead The halfback, known as Mr. Outside, who teamed with Doc Blanchard, Mr. Inside, as Heisman Trophy winners on undefeated Army teams in the 1940's, was 80.
PAGE A25
Christianity and the Climate A core group of influential evangelical Christians has put its considerable political clout behind efforts to combat global warming.
PAGE A16
2 Arrests in ImClone Case Two friends of Samuel D. Waksal, the former chief executive of ImClone, were arrested and charged with insider trading.
PAGE C1
Dan Rather Signs Off After 24 years as the CBS News anchor, Dan Rather signed off with the same exhortation he used soon after his debut: ''Courage.''
PAGE A16
